Comment: Yup. I tried. I didn't know that  questioning if someone was a bot is against the rules. So when my comment was deleted, it just said I broke rules. I've had that happen before and it was usually an automated bot or someone flagging the comment to get you in trouble. I would click on the link and get a reprieve.   One time the mod did not understand I was actually pro immigrant - I come from an immigrant family - he didn't grasp the comparison I was making and accused me of hate, sigh. This upset me so much that I tried to explain to him what I said was pro immigrant - but he threatened me with a permanent ban if I replied back, so I had to shut up.   This last time it was because I asked about the comment being deleted. There's a button to click , so I clicked and asked why and was told it was an automated delete , and I was going to be banned for the week.  ( If I hadn't clicked - I probably wouldn't have been banned! )   So I apologized and said I didn't know it was in the rules. They didn't care.
